title: My day in Paris
description:
Everywhere I look, there is something new and exciting to see, from the elegant architecture of the buildings to the bustling crowds of people on the streets.

The first thing that catches my eye is the magnificent Eiffel Tower, rising high above the skyline in all its grandeur. It is a true marvel of engineering, with its intricate metal lattice work and sparkling lights that twinkle in the night sky.

As I walk through the streets, I am struck by the incredible sense of history and culture that permeates every corner of this city. The grand boulevards are lined with majestic buildings, each one more beautiful than the last, with their ornate facades and intricate carvings.

The cafes and restaurants are bustling with life, with the smells of fresh bread and pastries filling the air. Everywhere I look, there are people sitting outside, sipping coffee and chatting with friends, their laughter and conversation blending together into a joyful hum.

In the distance, I can hear the faint sound of an accordion playing, adding to the romantic atmosphere of the city. The narrow streets are filled with artists and street performers, each one showcasing their unique talents and adding to the vibrant energy of the city.

And then, as the sun begins to set, the city transforms once again. The buildings and monuments are bathed in a warm, golden light, casting long shadows across the cobblestone streets. The sky above is ablaze with a riot of colors, from deep oranges and reds to soft pinks and purples, creating a stunning backdrop for the twinkling lights of the city below.

In that moment, I am struck by the sheer beauty of this city, and I know that I will carry the memories of my time here with me forever. Paris truly is a city of dreams, a place where anything is possible and every moment is filled with magic.

title: Growing Old
description:
As we grow older, we begin to notice subtle changes in ourselves and the world around us. Our bodies may start to ache and creak, and we may find ourselves moving a little slower than we used to. Our hair may gray, and our skin may wrinkle, but as we age, we also gain a new perspective on life.

We begin to see things in a different light, appreciating the beauty and complexity of the world in new ways. Memories from our youth may come flooding back, and we may find ourselves reflecting on the choices we've made and the paths we've taken.

There is a certain sense of bittersweet nostalgia that comes with growing old. We may long for the energy and excitement of our youth, yet we are also filled with a deep sense of gratitude for the experiences we've had and the people we've met along the way.

As we age, we may also feel a sense of urgency to make the most of the time we have left. We may want to travel, learn new skills, or spend more time with loved ones, knowing that our time on this earth is limited.

Despite the challenges that come with growing old, there is also a sense of liberation that comes with it. We may no longer feel the need to conform to societal expectations or worry about what others think of us. We can embrace our true selves and live life on our own terms.

Ultimately, growing old is a reminder that life is fleeting and precious. It is a journey that requires courage, resilience, and an open heart. As we continue to age, we can find solace in the fact that we are not alone in this journey, and that every moment, no matter how small, is a precious gift to be cherished.

title: The Art of Writing Poetry
description:
It is a craft that requires a deep understanding of language, rhythm, and emotion, as well as a willingness to explore the depths of the soul.

As a poet sits down to write, they are embarking on a journey of self-discovery, a quest to understand their innermost thoughts and feelings. With each carefully chosen word and phrase, they weave a tapestry of emotions, a rich and complex world that is uniquely their own.

The act of writing poetry is a dance between the heart and the mind, a delicate balance of structure and spontaneity. The poet must carefully consider the form and structure of their poem, but also allow themselves the freedom to explore their thoughts and feelings in a raw and authentic way.

At times, the act of writing poetry can be a form of therapy, a way to process and make sense of the world around us. It can be a way to confront our fears and anxieties, to explore the nuances of love and loss, and to connect with the deeper truths that lie at the heart of the human experience.

The beauty of poetry lies in its ability to transcend time and space, to capture the essence of a moment or emotion in a few carefully crafted words. It can transport us to another world, evoke a memory or a feeling long forgotten, or offer a new perspective on life.

In the hands of a skilled poet, words become tools of magic and transformation, capable of touching the hearts and minds of readers across the world. The act of writing poetry is a testament to the power of language, a celebration of the human spirit, and a reminder of the beauty that lies within us all.
text: It is a craft that requires a deep understanding of language, rhythm, and emotion, as well as a willingness to explore the depths of the soul.
explanation: It is a craft that requires a deep understanding of language, rhythm, and emotion, as well as a willingness to explore the depths of the soul.

The poet must carefully consider the form and structure of their poem, but also allow themselves the freedom to explore their thoughts and feelings in a raw and authentic way.

title: The Art of Writing Poetry
description:
It is a craft that requires a deep understanding of language, rhythm, and emotion, as well as a willingness to explore the depths of the soul.

As a poet sits down to write, they are embarking on a journey of self-discovery, a quest to understand their innermost thoughts and feelings. With each carefully chosen word and phrase, they weave a tapestry of emotions, a rich and complex world that is uniquely their own.

The act of writing poetry is a dance between the heart and the mind, a delicate balance of structure and spontaneity. The poet must carefully consider the form and structure of their poem, but also allow themselves the freedom to explore their thoughts and feelings in a raw and authentic way.

At times, the act of writing poetry can be a form of therapy, a way to process and make sense of the world around us. It can be a way to confront our fears and anxieties, to explore the nuances of love and loss, and to connect with the deeper truths that lie at the heart of the human experience.

The beauty of poetry lies in its ability to transcend time and space, to capture the essence of a moment or emotion in a few carefully crafted words. It can transport us to another world, evoke a memory or a feeling long forgotten, or offer a new perspective on life.

In the hands of a skilled poet, words become tools of magic and transformation, capable of touching the hearts and minds of readers across the world. The act of writing poetry is a testament to the power of language, a celebration of the human spirit, and a reminder of the beauty that lies within us all.

title: How we should talk
description:
Let’s talk not to impress but to be listened to. Let it lead nowhere.  Just tell me your name and I’ll ask you just what about these nights make everything so pretty. And you’ll tell me the first thing that comes to your mind even if it doesn’t sound artistic or intellectual. That’s okay I’ve heard them all, the legendary poets with their intricate verses and the boy bands with their borrowed lyrics but know what I haven’t heard? It’s what you think of it.

Tell me all about where you grew up and I’ll try and guess all your favorite things. Tell me what makes you so happy that you could cry and I’ll wonder in secret what makes you so sad that you can’t. We’ll talk effortlessly, one train of thought leading into another. With no destinations but meandering paths. Let the silences between our words remain and not be rushed and filled with sweet nothings . You see, during some of these silences we might stumble on something we’d never have thought of before.

Let’s smile when we feel like it and never to fake. Let’s take every breath like our first and launch into our best stories, our worst nightmares, our dreams and hopes, all without thought of how it will be perceived, without fear of being judged, without reluctance to admit and all with best regard. And when we tire, we shall admit. We won’t hold out or already plan the next time – no matter how good this time was – or try to get the last word. We will stop, shake hands and walk away with a head full of fodder and colors to fuel our musings for a few days.

And that is how we should talk.
